website_summaries.verdict: Made of high-quality materials for long-lasting performance.
pros: Gray and red colors make it stand out from the crowd
Strong laces won’t give way when you’re catching fast pitches
At 34 inches, the size is perfect for adult players
Arrives partially broken in so you can start using it quickly
cons: Price is a little high for the recreational-level player

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I play baseball in college and this is a great back up glove. I don’t know that this is a good glove for kids younger than 12. It’s kinda big for them. But good stuff
customer_reviews.author: Juan Cortes

customer_reviews.title: the glove is pretty stiff but that's expected with a brand new glove
customer_reviews.text: the glove is pretty stiff but that's expected with a brand new glove! My Son is a HS freshman catcher and absolutely loves this glove!
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: This glove was exceptionally hard to break in. We ...
customer_reviews.text: This glove was exceptionally hard to break in. We have had the glove for almost six months and it is still very hard, unable to squeeze. We have tried steaming, beating, using, and baking the glove all with no success. I feel as though the dye on this glove makes it VERY hard to break in. I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice glove
customer_reviews.text: very stiff at first. also a bit large for my 14 yr old
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Must take time to properly break in.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing glove, stand out and looks sharp. Mizuno quality is A+, took a minute to break in properly, but eats baseballs like a champ!
customer_reviews.author: Christy Knight

customer_reviews.title: Neat colors
customer_reviews.text: Too new to tell but my son is excited to use and breaking it in
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Bertetto

customer_reviews.title: It will be fine for what I need it for and a great ...
customer_reviews.text: Mitt is narrow in the wrist. I have trouble getting my hand in it. Took a while to break it in so don’t expect to use it right away. It will be fine for what I need it for and a great value.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Great glove. It was really stiff had to have ...
customer_reviews.text: Great glove. It was really stiff had to have it steamed n worked it alot. Not for a young catcher, or first time glove. Better have a back up glove.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Yates

customer_reviews.title: And love this
customer_reviews.text: My son is a high school varsity catcher. And love this glove
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice Mitt. I bought it for my 8yr old ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice Mitt. I bought it for my 8yr old son so I'm helping break it in. Leather is nice but makes it a little heavy. It was a nicer leather than I expected for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality glove
customer_reviews.text: After just 4 games the lacing broke in the pocket and no one here throws above 85 mph. Poor quality glove!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice glove a little stiffer than anticipated but part of the fun is breaking in with my son.
customer_reviews.author: TCcube

customer_reviews.title: Great Glove !
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Glove. I hear people saying it is hard to break in. Well you don't buy a new glove when you have a game that week. Buy it a month or 2 at least b4 the season starts and play everyday. The Glove will break in exactly how you use it.
customer_reviews.author: Silk Customs

product_meta.title: Mizuno MVP Prime Special Edition 34" Catchers Mitt - GXC50PSE5
